Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Extended query protocol: parse, bind, execute, describe FE/BE messages. Only lightly tested as yet, since libpq doesn't know anything about 'em.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Not sure why parser() was still doing clearerr(stdin) ... but it's *got* to be pointless.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Provide a real link to CREATE SEQUENCE's reference page in nextval/setval discussion.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Alter plpgsql's lexer so that yylineno and yymore are not used. This avoids 'input buffer overflow' failure on long literals, improves performance, gives the right answer for line position in functions containing multiline literals, suppresses annoying compiler warnings, and generally is so much better I wonder why we didn't do it before.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Ditch ExecGetTupType() in favor of the much simpler ExecGetResultType(), which does the same thing. Perhaps at one time there was a reason to allow plan nodes to store their result types in different places, but AFAICT that's been unnecessary for a good while.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Implement feature of new FE/BE protocol whereby RowDescription identifies the column by table OID and column number, if it's a simple column reference. Along the way, get rid of reskey/reskeyop fields in Resdoms. Turns out that representation was not convenient for either the planner or the executorSEMICOLON we can make the planner deliver exactly what the executor wants with no more effort. initdb forced due to change in stored rule representation.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Comment out some of the conditional tests until we have exec(). Reorder non-default variable loading until PGDATA is defined.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Rename internal variables DBName|dbName to dbname, for consistency.

Document.author: meskes
Document.document: Added rfmtlong compatibility function.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Restructure command destination handling so that we pass around DestReceiver pointers instead of just CommandDest values. The DestReceiver is made at the point where the destination is selected, rather than deep inside the executor. This cleans up the original kluge implementation of tstoreReceiver.c, and makes it easy to support retrieving results from utility statements inside portals. Thus, you can now do fun things like Bind and Execute a FETCH or EXPLAIN command, and it'll all work as expected (e.g., you can Describe the portal, or use Execute's count parameter to suspend the output partway through). Implementation involves stuffing the utility command's output into a Tuplestore, which would be kind of annoying for huge output sets, but should be quite acceptable for typical uses of utility commands.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Ensure that an Execute operation can't send tuples in cases where Describe would claim that no tuples will be returned. Only affects SELECTs added to non-SELECT base queries by rewrite rules. If you want to see the output of such a select, you gotta use 'simple Query' protocol.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Add display of eventual result RowDescription (if any) to the output of Describe on a prepared statement. This was in the original 3.0 protocol proposal, but I took it out for reasons that seemed good at the time. Put it back per yesterday's pghackers discussion.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Minor editorializing.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Properly test for buggy flex 2.5.3.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Pass shared memory id and socket descriptor number on command line for fork/exec.

Document.author: barry
Document.document: Fixed bug with Warnings. Warnings are not added to the Statement instead of the connection when appropriate. This checkin also adds the type map for jdbc3, however currently it is identical to the jdbc2 mapping. Modified Files: jdbc/org/postgresql/core/BaseStatement.java jdbc/org/postgresql/core/QueryExecutor.java jdbc/org/postgresql/jdbc3/AbstractJdbc3Connection.java

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix erroneous example, per Tim Knowles.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Change alternate database location patch to test for symlink() rather than WIN32.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Be more precise about check for flex 2.5.3, backpatched to 7.3.X.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Revise protocol doc for recently-agreed modifications. This is the first version of the 3.0 protocol that can be considered non-draft.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Update COPY BINARY file format spec to reflect recent decisions about external representation of binary data.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix documentation problem pointed out by Barry Lind: code expected a terminating zero byte in StartupMessage, docs didn't mention it.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Pass shared memory address on command line to exec'ed backend. Allow backends to attached to specified shared memory address.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Update 3.0 protocol support to match recent agreements about how to handle multiple 'formats' for data I/O. Restructure CommandDest and DestReceiver stuff one more time (it's finally starting to look a bit clean though). Code now matches latest 3.0 protocol document as far as message formats go --- but there is no support for binary I/O yet.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: I think we're done with protocol instability, so mark server and libpq as speaking the one true 3.0 protocol.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Move attached to shared memory out into a separate function for clarity.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Write non-defaults file before signalling the children to reread it.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Reinstate pg_type's typsend and typreceive columns. They don't do much yet, but they're there. Also some editorial work on CREATE TYPE reference page.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Add opendir/readdir/closedir() for Win32. Keep SRA copyright on file because it contains BSD license clause.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Binary send/receive routines for a few basic datatypes --- enough for testing purposes.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Pass canAcceptConnections to exec'ed backend, for Jan.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Add rint() to /port, remove from qnx/.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Remove another old rint() replacement.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Remove rint() prototype from QNX.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Add crypt() to /port for Win32.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: autoconf run for crypt().

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: More cleanups now that we have crypt().

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Implement new-protocol binary I/O support in DataRow, Bind, and FunctionCall messages. Binary I/O is now up and working, but only for a small set of datatypes (integers, text, bytea).

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Now that fastpath protocol allows null arguments to be passed, fastpath.c had better check for strict functions.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: COPY BINARY uses the new binary I/O routines. Update a few more datatypes so that COPY BINARY regression test passes.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Implement array_send/array_recv (binary I/O for arrays). This exposed the folly of not passing element type to typsend/typreceive, so fix that.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Add Makefile rules for new crypt/rint() /port functions. Add include for rint prototype.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Remove HPUX 9 rint() test. Cleanup new crypt() source code.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: More crypt() cleanup.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Adjust CreateCheckpoint so that buffer dumping activities and cleanup of dead xlog segments are not considered part of a critical section. It is not necessary to force a database-wide panic if we get a failure in these operations. Per recent trouble reports.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Adjust CreateCheckpoint so that buffer dumping activities and cleanup of dead xlog segments are not considered part of a critical section. It is not necessary to force a database-wide panic if we get a failure in these operations. Per recent trouble reports.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: In child-crashed log messages, identify a checkpoint process as such instead of calling it a 'server process'.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Make use of new error context stack mechanism to allow random errors detected during buffer dump to be labeled with the buffer location. For example, if a page LSN is clobbered, we now produce something like ERROR: XLogFlush: request 2C000000/8468EC8 is not satisfied --- flushed only to 0/8468EF0 CONTEXT: writing block 0 of relation 428946/566240 whereas before there was no convenient way to find out which page had been trashed.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Disable the recently-added use_physical_tlist optimization in cases where the table contains dropped columns. If the columns are dropped, then their types may be gone as well, which causes ExecTypeFromTL() to fail if the dropped columns appear in a plan node's tlist. This could be worked around but I don't think the optimization is valuable enough to be worth the trouble.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Revert previous change --- turns out the underlying problem affects more cases than I thought, so ExecTypeFromTL() will have to be fixed anyway.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Finish removing HPUXMATHLIB.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Apply fixes for problems with dropped columns whose types have also been dropped. The simplest fix for INSERT/UPDATE cases turns out to be for preptlist.c to insert NULLs of a known-good type (I used INT4) rather than making them match the deleted column's type. Since the representation of NULL is actually datatype-independent, this should work fine. I also re-reverted the patch to disable the use_physical_tlist optimization in the presence of dropped columns. It still doesn't look worth the trouble to be smarter, if there are no other bugs to fix. Added a regression test to catch future problems in this area.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Apply fixes for problems with dropped columns whose types have also been dropped. Add regression test, too.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Avoid unnecessary copying of parameter values in BIND. This allows efficient insertion of large bytea values through the BIND interface.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Add binary I/O routines for a bunch more datatypes. Still a few to go, but that was enough tedium for one day. Along the way, move the few support routines for types xid and cid into a more logical place.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Change pg_amop's index on (amopclaid,amopopr) to index (amopopr,amopclaid). This makes no difference for existing uses, but allows SelectSortFunction() and pred_test_simple_clause() to use indexscans instead of seqscans to locate entries for a particular operator in pg_amop. Better yet, they can use the SearchSysCacheList() API to cache the search results.

Document.author: meskes
Document.document: Fixed order of include file search path.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: More binary I/O routines.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: In RowDescription messages, report columns of domain datatypes as having the type OID and typmod of the underlying base type. Per discussions a few weeks ago with Andreas Pflug and others. Note that this behavioral change affects both old- and new-protocol clients.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Backend support for autocommit removed, per recent discussions. The only remnant of this failed experiment is that the server will take SET AUTOCOMMIT TO ON. Still TODO: provide some client-side autocommit logic in libpq.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix various recent build and regression-test problems in contrib/. Includes fixes from Joe Conway.

Document.author: meskes
Document.document: - Added more compatibility functions. - Accept CPP defines for type definitions. - Do not parse system include files automatically for Informix mode

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Add text(cidr) cast, per recent discussion. I'm not bothering to force an initdb for this.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix oversight: ignore-till-SYNC state should not ignore EOF ...

Document.author: petere
Document.document: Indexing support for pattern matching operations via separate operator class when lc_collate is not C.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Allow Win32 to compile under MinGW. Major changes are: Win32 port is now called 'win32' rather than 'win' add -lwsock32 on Win32 make gethostname() be only used when kerberos4 is enabled use /port/getopt.c new /port/opendir.c routines disable GUC unix_socket_group on Win32 convert some keywords.c symbols to KEYWORD_P to prevent conflict create new FCNTL_NONBLOCK macro to turn off socket blocking create new /include/port.h file that has /port prototypes, move out of c.h new /include/port/win32_include dir to hold missing include files work around ERROR being defined in Win32 includes

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Add missing win32 file --- seems best way to find these is to just commmit then do a cvs update again.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Add copydir() function because xcopy doesn't work in XP without a window.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Add missing #include.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Revert change of inclusion order for pg_config_os.hSEMICOLON this broke plperl on Linux and would have who knows what unpleasant effects on other platforms. If you need another include file for Windows, then add itSEMICOLON don't go messing with the semantics of every other port's include files.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Reorganize Win32 includes to only include <port.h> after system includes under Win32. Also fix other compile issues.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Remove use of geteuid under Win32.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Revert kerberos code breakage.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Allow interfaces to compile under MingGW/Win32 by adding _P to symbols in ecpg.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Check calling context for connectby_text(), per Joe Conway.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Check calling context for connectby_text(), per Joe Conway.

Document.author: meskes
Document.document: Fixed incorrect include and another typo. Sorry, the include did not create a warning/error/problem on my machine, so I didn't notice it.

Document.author: meskes
Document.document: Made variable type double work again.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Small changes to use the absolute path to system catalogs. Greg Sabino Mullane

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Small changes to use the absolute path to system catalogs. Greg Sabino Mullane

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Back-patch fix from Oliver Elphick to force ISO datestyle in dumps.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Back-patch fix to allow createuser to exit on control-C (Oliver Elphick)

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix failure when uniq-ifying an array of zero elements. Teodor Sigaev

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix failure when uniq-ifying an array of zero elements. Teodor Sigaev

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix breakage induced by recent patch (careless use of fmtId()).

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Add code to test for unknown timezone names (following some ideas from Ross Reedstrom, a couple months back) and to detect timezones that are using leap-second timekeeping. The unknown-zone-name test is pretty heuristic and ugly, but it seems better than the old behavior of just switching to GMT given a bad name. Also make DecodePosixTimezone() a tad more robust.

Document.author: petere
Document.document: Add documentation for information schema, and some corrections on some views.

Document.author: petere
Document.document: Small translation updates for 7.3.3 release.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Repair quoting sloppiness, lack of schema awareness in reindexdb.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Repair quoting sloppiness, lack of schema awareness in reindexdb.

Document.author: barry
Document.document: Upped JDBC build number to 110 for the 7.3.3 release Modified Files: Tag: REL7_3_STABLE Driver.java.in

Document.author: meskes
Document.document: Fixed exec sql ifdef command.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Back-patch change to avoid O(N^2) behavior with lots of deferred triggers, by making deferredTriggerInvokeEvents only scan events added since it last ran.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Rename Win32 include directory from win32_include to win32.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Use -fPIC on Sparc, per Tom Callaway.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Use -fPIC on Sparc, per Tom Callaway.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Add error message style guidelines to the SGML documentation.

Document.author: meskes
Document.document: Reversed my incorrect fix.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix coredump in pg_get_triggerdef, ensure function name is schema- qualified when necessary, simplify argument-printing code.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Back-patch Jan's fix to avoid primary key lookup (and lock) if foreign key does not change on UPDATE.

Document.author: meskes
Document.document: ecpg now recognizes named structs/unions. So you don't have to list the whole definition everytime you declare a variable anymore.

Document.author: meskes
Document.document: Removed one TODO item for ecpg as this is done.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Repair sometimes-incorrect computation of StartUpID after a crash, per example from Rao Kumar. This is a very corner corner-case, requiring a minimum of three closely-spaced database crashes and an unlucky positioning of the second recovery's checkpoint record before you'd notice any problem. But the consequences are dire enough that it's a must-fix.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Repair sometimes-incorrect computation of StartUpID after a crash, per example from Rao Kumar. This is a very corner corner-case, requiring a minimum of three closely-spaced database crashes and an unlucky positioning of the second recovery's checkpoint record before you'd notice any problem. But the consequences are dire enough that it's a must-fix.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Adjust configure so that extern tzname[] will be checked for independently of whether the struct tm tm_zone member exists. Also run autoheader, which seems not to have been done latelySEMICOLON it added about three more things to pg_config.h.in than I was expecting...

Document.author: meskes
Document.document: Fixed segfault when detecting undefined cursor.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Add defense against possibility that tzname[] doesn't exist.

Document.author: petere
Document.document: Fix compilation on Cygwin.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Update release history for impending 7.3.3 release.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Update release history for impending 7.3.3 release.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Add define for missing EAI_ADDRFAMILY in BSD/OS 4.3.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Brand 7.3.3.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Update for 7.3.3.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Update for 7.3.3.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Seems pl_funcs didn't have support for plpgsql PERFORM statement.

Document.author: meskes
Document.document: ecpg now accepts array elements as arguments.

Document.author: meskes
Document.document: Forgot these.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Place statement_timeout in proper order in docs, from Bruno Wolff III.

Document.author: meskes
Document.document: One more ecpg todo fixed and removed.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Improve implementation of btrim/ltrim/rtrim: provide a special case for single-byte encodings, and a direct C implementation of the single-argument forms (where spaces are always what gets trimmed). This is in preparation for using rtrim1() as the bpchar-to-text cast operator, but is a useful performance improvement even if we decide not to do that.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: With disabled triggers, allow pg_dump to use ALTER TABLE ADD FOREIGN KEY

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Add to TODO: * With disabled triggers, allow pg_dump to use ALTER TABLE ADD FOREIGN KEY Add to trigger TODO.detail.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Add cost estimate discussion to TODO.detail.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Added: > * Find a way to reduce rotational delay when repeatedly writing > last WAL page

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Update XML items: > * Allow backend to output result sets in XML > * Add XML capability to pg_dump and COPY, when backend XML capability

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Add: > * Allow clients to get data types, typmod, schema.table.column names from > result sets, either via the backend protocol or a new QUERYINFO command

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Update: < * Allow clients to get data types, typmod, schema.table.column names from < result sets, either via the backend protocol or a new QUERYINFO command to: > * Update clients to use data types, typmod, schema.table.column names of > result sets using new query protocol

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Move item: < * Update clients to use data types, typmod, schema.table.column names of < result sets using new query protocol 453a452,453 > o Update clients to use data types, typmod, schema.table.column names of > result sets using new query protocol

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Clean up our static cbrt() implementation in float.c.

Document.author: petere
Document.document: Information schema improvements

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Cause CHAR(n) to TEXT or VARCHAR conversion to automatically strip trailing blanks, in hopes of reducing the surprise factor for newbies. Remove redundant operators for VARCHAR (it depends wholly on TEXT operations now). Clean up resolution of ambiguous operators/functions to avoid surprising choices for domains: domains are treated as equivalent to their base types and binary-coercibility is no longer considered a preference item when choosing among multiple operators/functions. IsBinaryCoercible now correctly reflects the notion that you need *only* relabel the type to get from type A to type B: that is, a domain is binary-coercible to its base type, but not vice versa. Various marginal cleanup, including merging the essentially duplicate resolution code in parse_func.c and parse_oper.c. Improve opr_sanity regression test to understand about binary compatibility (using pg_cast), and fix a couple of small errors in the catalogs revealed thereby. Restructure "special operator" handling to fetch operators via index opclasses rather than hardwiring assumptions about names (cleans up the pattern_ops stuff a little).

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Remove comment that cbrt() isn't being used.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Add: > * Allow UPDATE to use SET col = DEFAULT

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Add documentation to 'createuser' that ALTER USER must be used to add or modify passwords, per user confusion report. Also clean up wording that command line utils need database access.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Make sure printtup() always sends the number of columns previously advertised in RowDescription message. Depending on the physical tuple's column count is not really correct, since according to heap_getattr() conventions the tuple may be short some columns, which will automatically get read as nulls. Problem has been latent since forever, but was only exposed by recent change to skip a projection step in SELECT * FROM...

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Update: < * Add now("transaction|statement|clock") functionality > * Add transaction_timestamp(), statement_timestamp(), clock_timestamp() functionality

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix misstatement in release-notes item.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix misstatement in release-notes item.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Add item for changing a column's data type.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Adjust error-handling logic in libpq. For the first time, libpq copes sanely with running out of memory for a query result.

Document.author: meskes
Document.document: Fixed incorrect output for some structs.

Document.author: meskes
Document.document: Allow input from stdin and output to stdout.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Add configure thread tests.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Make debug_ GUC varables output DEBUG1 rather than LOG, and mention in docs that CLIENT/LOG_MIN_MESSAGES now controls debug_* output location. Doc changes included.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Make log_ GUC settings controllable only by super-users, so non-super users can't turn it off.

Document.author: petere
Document.document: Internationalize interactive yes/no responses.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Add info about selecting a random row.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Add to thread discussion.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Replace functional-index facility with expressional indexes. Any column of an index can now be a computed expression instead of a simple variable. Restrictions on expressions are the same as for predicates (only immutable functions, no sub-selects). This fixes problems recently introduced with inlining SQL functions, because the inlining transformation is applied to both expression trees so the planner can still match them up. Along the way, improve efficiency of handling index predicates (both predicates and index expressions are now cached by the relcache) and fix 7.3 oversight that didn't record dependencies of predicate expressions.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: In bootstrap and standalone-backend modes, do not sort LOG elevel out of orderSEMICOLON the 'server log' output is actually client output in these scenarios and we ought to treat elevels the same way as in the client case. This allows initdb to not send backend stderr to /dev/null anymore, which makes it much more likely that people will notice problems during initdb.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix things so that an error occuring during standalone-backend processing in initdb will result in exit(1), allowing the initdb script to realize that there's something wrong.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix breakage of LINUX_PROFILE code due to recent Windows changes.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix some planner performance problems with large WHERE clauses, by introducing new 'FastList' list-construction subroutines to use in hot spots. This avoids the O(N^2) behavior of repeated lappend's by keeping a tail pointer, while not changing behavior by reversing list order as the lcons() method would do.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Knock down a couple more lappend() hotspots for large WHERE clauses.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix stupid oversight :-(

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Add a regression test to catch future silliness in the index-building area...

Document.author: barry
Document.document: Initial attempt to integrate in V3 protocol support. This is still a work in progress, although all RTs pass using the V3 protocol on a 7.4 database and also pass using the V2 protocol on a 7.3 database. SSL support is known not to work. Modified Files: jdbc/org/postgresql/PGConnection.java jdbc/org/postgresql/errors.properties jdbc/org/postgresql/core/BaseConnection.java jdbc/org/postgresql/core/Encoding.java jdbc/org/postgresql/core/Field.java jdbc/org/postgresql/core/PGStream.java jdbc/org/postgresql/core/QueryExecutor.java jdbc/org/postgresql/core/StartupPacket.java jdbc/org/postgresql/fastpath/Fastpath.java jdbc/org/postgresql/fastpath/FastpathArg.java jdbc/org/postgresql/jdbc1/AbstractJdbc1Connection.java jdbc/org/postgresql/test/jdbc2/BlobTest.java jdbc/org/postgresql/test/jdbc2/CallableStmtTest.java jdbc/org/postgresql/test/jdbc2/MiscTest.java jdbc/org/postgresql/test/jdbc3/Jdbc3TestSuite.java

Document.author: barry
Document.document: Up the build number to reflect the changes for V3 protocol support

Document.author: barry
Document.document: Adding .cvsignore files for Eclipse IDE

Document.author: barry
Document.document: clean up warnings produced by Eclipse

Document.author: barry
Document.document: Applied patch from Fernando Nasser to improve buffer sizes to avoid unnecessary resizing.

Document.author: barry
Document.document: Applied patch from Fernando Nasser to fix up small type error

Document.author: meskes
Document.document: Parse forward definiton of structs.

Document.author: meskes
Document.document: Changed variable parsing so struct[n].attr works.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: AFAICT, none of our shared libraries are anywhere near big enough to need -fPIC on HPPA. Reduce to -fpic.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Don't explicitly close() the session socket during backend exitSEMICOLON instead leave it for the kernel to do after the process dies. This allows clients to wait for the backend to exit if they wish (after sending X message, wait till EOF is detected on the socket).

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Adopt latest bison's spelling of 'syntax error' rather than 'parse error' for grammar-detected problems. Revert Makefile hack that kept it looking like the pre-bison-1.875 output.

Document.author: barry
Document.document: one more change to correctly support the removeall of autocommit

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Ensure that in all flex lexers that are part of the backend, a yy_fatal_error() call results in elog(ERROR) not exit(). This was already fixed in the main lexer and plpgsql, but extend same technique to all the other dot-l files. Also, on review of the possible calls to yy_fatal_error(), it seems safe to use elog(ERROR) not elog(FATAL).

Document.author: meskes
Document.document: Sync and some minor cleanup/fixing work plus an EXEC SQL DESCRIBE prototype.

Document.author: meskes
Document.document: Create a real prototype function for describe.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Small performance improvement for hash joins and hash aggregation: when the plan is ReScanned, we don't have to rebuild the hash table if there is no parameter change for its child node. This idea has been used for a long time in Sort and Material nodes, but was not in the hash code till now.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Cause pg_dumpall to include GRANT/REVOKE for database-level permissions in its output. Make it work with server versions back to 7.0, too.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Cause pg_dumpall to support the -a, -s, -x options of pg_dump.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Add item about sending success stories to http://advocacy.postgresql.org.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Add: > * Consider using MVCC to cache count(*) queries with no WHERE clause

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Add: > * Prevent whole-row references from leaking memory, e.g. SELECT COUNT(tab.*)

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: markTargetListOrigin neglected to handle outer-scope Vars properlySEMICOLON per report from Joe Conway.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Add: > * Add config variable to prevent auto-adding missing FROM-clause tables

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Update Emacs settings, from Andrew Dunstan

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Update URL to point to proper location.

Document.author: meskes
Document.document: Fixed segfault in forward definition parsing.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Update Russian FAQ, from Viktor Vislobokov

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Add: > * Allow SET CONSTRAINTS to be qualified by schema/table

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Add Turkish FAQ, from Devrim GUNDUZ.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Add data partitioning idea to tablespaces discussion.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Add: > * Allow a single index to index multiple tables (for inheritance and subtables) 408a410 > * Improve the planner to use CHECK constraints to prune the plan (for subtables) 418a421 > * Allow partitioning of table into multiple subtables 419a423 > T

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Add: > * Allow logging of only data definition(DDL), or DDL and modification statements

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: In src/include/mb/pg_wchar.h we have: #define PG_ENCODING_BE_LAST PG_ISO_8859_8 #define PG_ENCODING_FE_LAST PG_WIN1256 but the last client encoding in the enum list is actually PG_GB18030 and it seems that #define PG_ENCODING_IS_CLIEN_ONLY(_enc) BACKSLASH (((_enc) > PG_ENCODING_BE_LAST && (_enc) <= PG_ENCODING_FE_LAST) can never be true. I think the define should read #define PG_ENCODING_FE_LAST PG_GB18030 On the other hand, perhaps no-one cares, because PG_ENCODING_IS_CLIEN_ONLY is never used. -- Oliver Elphick Oliver.Elphick@lfix.co.uk

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Make the world at least marginally safe for usernames with embedded spaces. Per recent gripe.

Document.author: meskes
Document.document: Parse forward definiton of structs.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Knock down a couple more lappend() hotspots for large WHERE clauses.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Clean up our static cbrt() implementation in float.c.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix coredump in pg_get_triggerdef, ensure function name is schema- qualified when necessary, simplify argument-printing code.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Revert change of inclusion order for pg_config_os.hSEMICOLON this broke plperl on Linux and would have who knows what unpleasant effects on other platforms. If you need another include file for Windows, then add itSEMICOLON don't go messing with the semantics of every other port's include files.

Document.author: meskes
Document.document: - Added more compatibility functions. - Accept CPP defines for type definitions. - Do not parse system include files automatically for Informix mode

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Avoid unnecessary copying of parameter values in BIND. This allows efficient insertion of large bytea values through the BIND interface.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Now that fastpath protocol allows null arguments to be passed, fastpath.c had better check for strict functions.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix documentation problem pointed out by Barry Lind: code expected a terminating zero byte in StartupMessage, docs didn't mention it.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Properly test for buggy flex 2.5.3.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Extended query protocol: parse, bind, execute, describe FE/BE messages. Only lightly tested as yet, since libpq doesn't know anything about 'em.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Add: > * Consider using MVCC to cache count(*) queries with no WHERE clause

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Update release history for impending 7.3.3 release.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Update release history for impending 7.3.3 release.

Document.author: petere
Document.document: Fix compilation on Cygwin.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Adjust CreateCheckpoint so that buffer dumping activities and cleanup of dead xlog segments are not considered part of a critical section. It is not necessary to force a database-wide panic if we get a failure in these operations. Per recent trouble reports.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Adjust CreateCheckpoint so that buffer dumping activities and cleanup of dead xlog segments are not considered part of a critical section. It is not necessary to force a database-wide panic if we get a failure in these operations. Per recent trouble reports.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Update 3.0 protocol support to match recent agreements about how to handle multiple 'formats' for data I/O. Restructure CommandDest and DestReceiver stuff one more time (it's finally starting to look a bit clean though). Code now matches latest 3.0 protocol document as far as message formats go --- but there is no support for binary I/O yet.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Not sure why parser() was still doing clearerr(stdin) ... but it's *got* to be pointless.

Document.author: meskes
Document.document: Fixed segfault in forward definition parsing.

Document.author: barry
Document.document: clean up warnings produced by Eclipse

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix stupid oversight :-(

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Place statement_timeout in proper order in docs, from Bruno Wolff III.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Back-patch fix to allow createuser to exit on control-C (Oliver Elphick)

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Implement array_send/array_recv (binary I/O for arrays). This exposed the folly of not passing element type to typsend/typreceive, so fix that.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Implement new-protocol binary I/O support in DataRow, Bind, and FunctionCall messages. Binary I/O is now up and working, but only for a small set of datatypes (integers, text, bytea).

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Change alternate database location patch to test for symlink() rather than WIN32.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Provide a real link to CREATE SEQUENCE's reference page in nextval/setval discussion.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Add item about sending success stories to http://advocacy.postgresql.org.

Document.author: barry
Document.document: Adding .cvsignore files for Eclipse IDE

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Improve implementation of btrim/ltrim/rtrim: provide a special case for single-byte encodings, and a direct C implementation of the single-argument forms (where spaces are always what gets trimmed). This is in preparation for using rtrim1() as the bpchar-to-text cast operator, but is a useful performance improvement even if we decide not to do that.

Document.author: meskes
Document.document: Fixed segfault when detecting undefined cursor.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Add code to test for unknown timezone names (following some ideas from Ross Reedstrom, a couple months back) and to detect timezones that are using leap-second timekeeping. The unknown-zone-name test is pretty heuristic and ugly, but it seems better than the old behavior of just switching to GMT given a bad name. Also make DecodePosixTimezone() a tad more robust.

Document.author: meskes
Document.document: Made variable type double work again.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Add missing win32 file --- seems best way to find these is to just commmit then do a cvs update again.

Document.author: petere
Document.document: Indexing support for pattern matching operations via separate operator class when lc_collate is not C.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Remove HPUX 9 rint() test. Cleanup new crypt() source code.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Add crypt() to /port for Win32.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Pass canAcceptConnections to exec'ed backend, for Jan.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Ditch ExecGetTupType() in favor of the much simpler ExecGetResultType(), which does the same thing. Perhaps at one time there was a reason to allow plan nodes to store their result types in different places, but AFAICT that's been unnecessary for a good while.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Alter plpgsql's lexer so that yylineno and yymore are not used. This avoids 'input buffer overflow' failure on long literals, improves performance, gives the right answer for line position in functions containing multiline literals, suppresses annoying compiler warnings, and generally is so much better I wonder why we didn't do it before.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Make the world at least marginally safe for usernames with embedded spaces. Per recent gripe.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Update Russian FAQ, from Viktor Vislobokov

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Don't explicitly close() the session socket during backend exitSEMICOLON instead leave it for the kernel to do after the process dies. This allows clients to wait for the backend to exit if they wish (after sending X message, wait till EOF is detected on the socket).

Document.author: meskes
Document.document: Changed variable parsing so struct[n].attr works.

Document.author: barry
Document.document: Up the build number to reflect the changes for V3 protocol support

Document.author: meskes
Document.document: ecpg now accepts array elements as arguments.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Write non-defaults file before signalling the children to reread it.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Rename internal variables DBName|dbName to dbname, for consistency.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Implement feature of new FE/BE protocol whereby RowDescription identifies the column by table OID and column number, if it's a simple column reference. Along the way, get rid of reskey/reskeyop fields in Resdoms. Turns out that representation was not convenient for either the planner or the executorSEMICOLON we can make the planner deliver exactly what the executor wants with no more effort. initdb forced due to change in stored rule representation.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Small performance improvement for hash joins and hash aggregation: when the plan is ReScanned, we don't have to rebuild the hash table if there is no parameter change for its child node. This idea has been used for a long time in Sort and Material nodes, but was not in the hash code till now.

Document.author: petere
Document.document: Internationalize interactive yes/no responses.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Add cost estimate discussion to TODO.detail.

Document.author: meskes
Document.document: One more ecpg todo fixed and removed.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Revise protocol doc for recently-agreed modifications. This is the first version of the 3.0 protocol that can be considered non-draft.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Add display of eventual result RowDescription (if any) to the output of Describe on a prepared statement. This was in the original 3.0 protocol proposal, but I took it out for reasons that seemed good at the time. Put it back per yesterday's pghackers discussion.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Comment out some of the conditional tests until we have exec(). Reorder non-default variable loading until PGDATA is defined.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Cause CHAR(n) to TEXT or VARCHAR conversion to automatically strip trailing blanks, in hopes of reducing the surprise factor for newbies. Remove redundant operators for VARCHAR (it depends wholly on TEXT operations now). Clean up resolution of ambiguous operators/functions to avoid surprising choices for domains: domains are treated as equivalent to their base types and binary-coercibility is no longer considered a preference item when choosing among multiple operators/functions. IsBinaryCoercible now correctly reflects the notion that you need *only* relabel the type to get from type A to type B: that is, a domain is binary-coercible to its base type, but not vice versa. Various marginal cleanup, including merging the essentially duplicate resolution code in parse_func.c and parse_oper.c. Improve opr_sanity regression test to understand about binary compatibility (using pg_cast), and fix a couple of small errors in the catalogs revealed thereby. Restructure "special operator" handling to fetch operators via index opclasses rather than hardwiring assumptions about names (cleans up the pattern_ops stuff a little).

Document.author: meskes
Document.document: ecpg now recognizes named structs/unions. So you don't have to list the whole definition everytime you declare a variable anymore.

Document.author: meskes
Document.document: Fixed incorrect include and another typo. Sorry, the include did not create a warning/error/problem on my machine, so I didn't notice it.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Reinstate pg_type's typsend and typreceive columns. They don't do much yet, but they're there. Also some editorial work on CREATE TYPE reference page.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Ensure that an Execute operation can't send tuples in cases where Describe would claim that no tuples will be returned. Only affects SELECTs added to non-SELECT base queries by rewrite rules. If you want to see the output of such a select, you gotta use 'simple Query' protocol.

Document.author: meskes
Document.document: Added rfmtlong compatibility function.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Seems pl_funcs didn't have support for plpgsql PERFORM statement.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Add defense against possibility that tzname[] doesn't exist.

Document.author: meskes
Document.document: Fixed order of include file search path.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Make use of new error context stack mechanism to allow random errors detected during buffer dump to be labeled with the buffer location. For example, if a page LSN is clobbered, we now produce something like ERROR: XLogFlush: request 2C000000/8468EC8 is not satisfied --- flushed only to 0/8468EF0 CONTEXT: writing block 0 of relation 428946/566240 whereas before there was no convenient way to find out which page had been trashed.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Restructure command destination handling so that we pass around DestReceiver pointers instead of just CommandDest values. The DestReceiver is made at the point where the destination is selected, rather than deep inside the executor. This cleans up the original kluge implementation of tstoreReceiver.c, and makes it easy to support retrieving results from utility statements inside portals. Thus, you can now do fun things like Bind and Execute a FETCH or EXPLAIN command, and it'll all work as expected (e.g., you can Describe the portal, or use Execute's count parameter to suspend the output partway through). Implementation involves stuffing the utility command's output into a Tuplestore, which would be kind of annoying for huge output sets, but should be quite acceptable for typical uses of utility commands.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Add: > * Add config variable to prevent auto-adding missing FROM-clause tables

Document.author: barry
Document.document: Applied patch from Fernando Nasser to improve buffer sizes to avoid unnecessary resizing.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Allow Win32 to compile under MinGW. Major changes are: Win32 port is now called 'win32' rather than 'win' add -lwsock32 on Win32 make gethostname() be only used when kerberos4 is enabled use /port/getopt.c new /port/opendir.c routines disable GUC unix_socket_group on Win32 convert some keywords.c symbols to KEYWORD_P to prevent conflict create new FCNTL_NONBLOCK macro to turn off socket blocking create new /include/port.h file that has /port prototypes, move out of c.h new /include/port/win32_include dir to hold missing include files work around ERROR being defined in Win32 includes

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Add binary I/O routines for a bunch more datatypes. Still a few to go, but that was enough tedium for one day. Along the way, move the few support routines for types xid and cid into a more logical place.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: I think we're done with protocol instability, so mark server and libpq as speaking the one true 3.0 protocol.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Pass shared memory address on command line to exec'ed backend. Allow backends to attached to specified shared memory address.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Minor editorializing.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Add data partitioning idea to tablespaces discussion.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Ensure that in all flex lexers that are part of the backend, a yy_fatal_error() call results in elog(ERROR) not exit(). This was already fixed in the main lexer and plpgsql, but extend same technique to all the other dot-l files. Also, on review of the possible calls to yy_fatal_error(), it seems safe to use elog(ERROR) not elog(FATAL).

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Add a regression test to catch future silliness in the index-building area...

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Add to thread discussion.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Add configure thread tests.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Repair quoting sloppiness, lack of schema awareness in reindexdb.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Repair quoting sloppiness, lack of schema awareness in reindexdb.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix oversight: ignore-till-SYNC state should not ignore EOF ...

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Update COPY BINARY file format spec to reflect recent decisions about external representation of binary data.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Pass shared memory id and socket descriptor number on command line for fork/exec.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Add: > * Allow SET CONSTRAINTS to be qualified by schema/table

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Update Emacs settings, from Andrew Dunstan

Document.author: barry
Document.document: Applied patch from Fernando Nasser to fix up small type error

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Add documentation to 'createuser' that ALTER USER must be used to add or modify passwords, per user confusion report. Also clean up wording that command line utils need database access.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Adjust configure so that extern tzname[] will be checked for independently of whether the struct tm tm_zone member exists. Also run autoheader, which seems not to have been done latelySEMICOLON it added about three more things to pg_config.h.in than I was expecting...

Document.author: petere
Document.document: Small translation updates for 7.3.3 release.

Document.author: petere
Document.document: Add documentation for information schema, and some corrections on some views.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix breakage induced by recent patch (careless use of fmtId()).

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Check calling context for connectby_text(), per Joe Conway.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Check calling context for connectby_text(), per Joe Conway.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Add text(cidr) cast, per recent discussion. I'm not bothering to force an initdb for this.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Remove rint() prototype from QNX.

Document.author: barry
Document.document: Fixed bug with Warnings. Warnings are not added to the Statement instead of the connection when appropriate. This checkin also adds the type map for jdbc3, however currently it is identical to the jdbc2 mapping. Modified Files: jdbc/org/postgresql/core/BaseStatement.java jdbc/org/postgresql/core/QueryExecutor.java jdbc/org/postgresql/jdbc3/AbstractJdbc3Connection.java

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix misstatement in release-notes item.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix misstatement in release-notes item.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Add: > * Allow UPDATE to use SET col = DEFAULT

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Move item: < * Update clients to use data types, typmod, schema.table.column names of < result sets using new query protocol 453a452,453 > o Update clients to use data types, typmod, schema.table.column names of > result sets using new query protocol

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Update: < * Allow clients to get data types, typmod, schema.table.column names from < result sets, either via the backend protocol or a new QUERYINFO command to: > * Update clients to use data types, typmod, schema.table.column names of > result sets using new query protocol

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Add: > * Allow clients to get data types, typmod, schema.table.column names from > result sets, either via the backend protocol or a new QUERYINFO command

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Back-patch Jan's fix to avoid primary key lookup (and lock) if foreign key does not change on UPDATE.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Rename Win32 include directory from win32_include to win32.

Document.author: meskes
Document.document: Fixed exec sql ifdef command.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix various recent build and regression-test problems in contrib/. Includes fixes from Joe Conway.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: COPY BINARY uses the new binary I/O routines. Update a few more datatypes so that COPY BINARY regression test passes.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Binary send/receive routines for a few basic datatypes --- enough for testing purposes.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix erroneous example, per Tim Knowles.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: In src/include/mb/pg_wchar.h we have: #define PG_ENCODING_BE_LAST PG_ISO_8859_8 #define PG_ENCODING_FE_LAST PG_WIN1256 but the last client encoding in the enum list is actually PG_GB18030 and it seems that #define PG_ENCODING_IS_CLIEN_ONLY(_enc) BACKSLASH (((_enc) > PG_ENCODING_BE_LAST && (_enc) <= PG_ENCODING_FE_LAST) can never be true. I think the define should read #define PG_ENCODING_FE_LAST PG_GB18030 On the other hand, perhaps no-one cares, because PG_ENCODING_IS_CLIEN_ONLY is never used. -- Oliver Elphick Oliver.Elphick@lfix.co.uk

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Add: > * Allow a single index to index multiple tables (for inheritance and subtables) 408a410 > * Improve the planner to use CHECK constraints to prune the plan (for subtables) 418a421 > * Allow partitioning of table into multiple subtables 419a423 > T

Document.author: meskes
Document.document: Sync and some minor cleanup/fixing work plus an EXEC SQL DESCRIBE prototype.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Update: < * Add now("transaction|statement|clock") functionality > * Add transaction_timestamp(), statement_timestamp(), clock_timestamp() functionality

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Add define for missing EAI_ADDRFAMILY in BSD/OS 4.3.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix failure when uniq-ifying an array of zero elements. Teodor Sigaev

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix failure when uniq-ifying an array of zero elements. Teodor Sigaev

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Allow interfaces to compile under MingGW/Win32 by adding _P to symbols in ecpg.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Add missing #include.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Add copydir() function because xcopy doesn't work in XP without a window.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Add opendir/readdir/closedir() for Win32. Keep SRA copyright on file because it contains BSD license clause.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Move attached to shared memory out into a separate function for clarity.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Be more precise about check for flex 2.5.3, backpatched to 7.3.X.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: markTargetListOrigin neglected to handle outer-scope Vars properlySEMICOLON per report from Joe Conway.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Cause pg_dumpall to support the -a, -s, -x options of pg_dump.

Document.author: meskes
Document.document: Allow input from stdin and output to stdout.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Update XML items: > * Allow backend to output result sets in XML > * Add XML capability to pg_dump and COPY, when backend XML capability

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Added: > * Find a way to reduce rotational delay when repeatedly writing > last WAL page

Document.author: barry
Document.document: Upped JDBC build number to 110 for the 7.3.3 release Modified Files: Tag: REL7_3_STABLE Driver.java.in

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Backend support for autocommit removed, per recent discussions. The only remnant of this failed experiment is that the server will take SET AUTOCOMMIT TO ON. Still TODO: provide some client-side autocommit logic in libpq.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Revert previous change --- turns out the underlying problem affects more cases than I thought, so ExecTypeFromTL() will have to be fixed anyway.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Add Makefile rules for new crypt/rint() /port functions. Add include for rint prototype.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Add rint() to /port, remove from qnx/.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Cause pg_dumpall to include GRANT/REVOKE for database-level permissions in its output. Make it work with server versions back to 7.0, too.

Document.author: barry
Document.document: Initial attempt to integrate in V3 protocol support. This is still a work in progress, although all RTs pass using the V3 protocol on a 7.4 database and also pass using the V2 protocol on a 7.3 database. SSL support is known not to work. Modified Files: jdbc/org/postgresql/PGConnection.java jdbc/org/postgresql/errors.properties jdbc/org/postgresql/core/BaseConnection.java jdbc/org/postgresql/core/Encoding.java jdbc/org/postgresql/core/Field.java jdbc/org/postgresql/core/PGStream.java jdbc/org/postgresql/core/QueryExecutor.java jdbc/org/postgresql/core/StartupPacket.java jdbc/org/postgresql/fastpath/Fastpath.java jdbc/org/postgresql/fastpath/FastpathArg.java jdbc/org/postgresql/jdbc1/AbstractJdbc1Connection.java jdbc/org/postgresql/test/jdbc2/BlobTest.java jdbc/org/postgresql/test/jdbc2/CallableStmtTest.java jdbc/org/postgresql/test/jdbc2/MiscTest.java jdbc/org/postgresql/test/jdbc3/Jdbc3TestSuite.java

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix some planner performance problems with large WHERE clauses, by introducing new 'FastList' list-construction subroutines to use in hot spots. This avoids the O(N^2) behavior of repeated lappend's by keeping a tail pointer, while not changing behavior by reversing list order as the lcons() method would do.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Remove comment that cbrt() isn't being used.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Revert kerberos code breakage.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Reorganize Win32 includes to only include <port.h> after system includes under Win32. Also fix other compile issues.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Remove another old rint() replacement.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Add: > * Allow logging of only data definition(DDL), or DDL and modification statements

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Add: > * Prevent whole-row references from leaking memory, e.g. SELECT COUNT(tab.*)

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Adopt latest bison's spelling of 'syntax error' rather than 'parse error' for grammar-detected problems. Revert Makefile hack that kept it looking like the pre-bison-1.875 output.

Document.author: meskes
Document.document: Fixed incorrect output for some structs.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Make sure printtup() always sends the number of columns previously advertised in RowDescription message. Depending on the physical tuple's column count is not really correct, since according to heap_getattr() conventions the tuple may be short some columns, which will automatically get read as nulls. Problem has been latent since forever, but was only exposed by recent change to skip a projection step in SELECT * FROM...

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Remove use of geteuid under Win32.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: autoconf run for crypt().

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Add Turkish FAQ, from Devrim GUNDUZ.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Update URL to point to proper location.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Replace functional-index facility with expressional indexes. Any column of an index can now be a computed expression instead of a simple variable. Restrictions on expressions are the same as for predicates (only immutable functions, no sub-selects). This fixes problems recently introduced with inlining SQL functions, because the inlining transformation is applied to both expression trees so the planner can still match them up. Along the way, improve efficiency of handling index predicates (both predicates and index expressions are now cached by the relcache) and fix 7.3 oversight that didn't record dependencies of predicate expressions.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Make log_ GUC settings controllable only by super-users, so non-super users can't turn it off.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Make debug_ GUC varables output DEBUG1 rather than LOG, and mention in docs that CLIENT/LOG_MIN_MESSAGES now controls debug_* output location. Doc changes included.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Add error message style guidelines to the SGML documentation.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: More crypt() cleanup.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: More cleanups now that we have crypt().

Document.author: meskes
Document.document: Create a real prototype function for describe.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix things so that an error occuring during standalone-backend processing in initdb will result in exit(1), allowing the initdb script to realize that there's something wrong.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: In bootstrap and standalone-backend modes, do not sort LOG elevel out of orderSEMICOLON the 'server log' output is actually client output in these scenarios and we ought to treat elevels the same way as in the client case. This allows initdb to not send backend stderr to /dev/null anymore, which makes it much more likely that people will notice problems during initdb.

Document.author: meskes
Document.document: Forgot these.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Update for 7.3.3.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Update for 7.3.3.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Brand 7.3.3.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Repair sometimes-incorrect computation of StartUpID after a crash, per example from Rao Kumar. This is a very corner corner-case, requiring a minimum of three closely-spaced database crashes and an unlucky positioning of the second recovery's checkpoint record before you'd notice any problem. But the consequences are dire enough that it's a must-fix.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Repair sometimes-incorrect computation of StartUpID after a crash, per example from Rao Kumar. This is a very corner corner-case, requiring a minimum of three closely-spaced database crashes and an unlucky positioning of the second recovery's checkpoint record before you'd notice any problem. But the consequences are dire enough that it's a must-fix.

Document.author: meskes
Document.document: Removed one TODO item for ecpg as this is done.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Finish removing HPUXMATHLIB.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: In child-crashed log messages, identify a checkpoint process as such instead of calling it a 'server process'.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix breakage of LINUX_PROFILE code due to recent Windows changes.

Document.author: meskes
Document.document: Reversed my incorrect fix.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Back-patch change to avoid O(N^2) behavior with lots of deferred triggers, by making deferredTriggerInvokeEvents only scan events added since it last ran.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Back-patch fix from Oliver Elphick to force ISO datestyle in dumps.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Small changes to use the absolute path to system catalogs. Greg Sabino Mullane

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Small changes to use the absolute path to system catalogs. Greg Sabino Mullane

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Apply fixes for problems with dropped columns whose types have also been dropped. Add regression test, too.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Apply fixes for problems with dropped columns whose types have also been dropped. The simplest fix for INSERT/UPDATE cases turns out to be for preptlist.c to insert NULLs of a known-good type (I used INT4) rather than making them match the deleted column's type. Since the representation of NULL is actually datatype-independent, this should work fine. I also re-reverted the patch to disable the use_physical_tlist optimization in the presence of dropped columns. It still doesn't look worth the trouble to be smarter, if there are no other bugs to fix. Added a regression test to catch future problems in this area.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Disable the recently-added use_physical_tlist optimization in cases where the table contains dropped columns. If the columns are dropped, then their types may be gone as well, which causes ExecTypeFromTL() to fail if the dropped columns appear in a plan node's tlist. This could be worked around but I don't think the optimization is valuable enough to be worth the trouble.

Document.author: barry
Document.document: one more change to correctly support the removeall of autocommit

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: AFAICT, none of our shared libraries are anywhere near big enough to need -fPIC on HPPA. Reduce to -fpic.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Add info about selecting a random row.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Adjust error-handling logic in libpq. For the first time, libpq copes sanely with running out of memory for a query result.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Add item for changing a column's data type.

Document.document: Information schema improvements

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Use -fPIC on Sparc, per Tom Callaway.

Document.document: Use -fPIC on Sparc, per Tom Callaway.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: In RowDescription messages, report columns of domain datatypes as having the type OID and typmod of the underlying base type. Per discussions a few weeks ago with Andreas Pflug and others. Note that this behavioral change affects both old- and new-protocol clients.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: More binary I/O routines.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Change pg_amop's index on (amopclaid,amopopr) to index (amopopr,amopclaid). This makes no difference for existing uses, but allows SelectSortFunction() and pred_test_simple_clause() to use indexscans instead of seqscans to locate entries for a particular operator in pg_amop. Better yet, they can use the SearchSysCacheList() API to cache the search results.
